thread.title: Manchester United transfer news and rumours: Red Devils to resurrect deal for Victor Lindelof this summer?
thread.title_full: Manchester United transfer news and rumours: Red Devils to resurrect deal for Victor Lindelof this summer?

author: James Whaling
title: Manchester United transfer news and rumours: Red Devils to resurrect deal for Victor Lindelof this summer?
text:
United could go back in for Lindelof (Photo: Gualter Fatia/Getty) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United could resurrect their pursuit of Benfica defender Victor Lindelof in the summer after a stumbling block was removed from his contract. 
According to Portuguese outlet O Jogo, a troublesome sell-on clause to former club Vasteras has now been removed after Benfica paid £4.3million. 
That could allow United to land the player when the transfer window reopens in July. 
The Red Devils tried to sign Lindelof throughout January but failed to strike a deal with the Portuguse giants. Tuanzebe signs new deal Tuanzebe has penned fresh terms (Photo: Gareth Copley) 
Axel Tuanzebe has signed a new contract at Manchester United until 2020 with the option for a further year. 
Defender Tuanzebe, 19, made his United debut in Sunday's 4-0 FA Cup rout of Wigan, with boss Jose Mourinho impressed by his potential, writes Mirror Football's David McDonnell. 
Tuanzebe, who has been at United since he was eight, said: “I've always been a Manchester United supporter so I'm naturally delighted to have signed a new contract. 
“To make my debut at Old Trafford in the FA Cup was a very proud moment, both for me and for my family." 
Mourinho said: "Axel is a young player with great potential. We brought him up to the first-team to give him more experience and he has adapted really well." Zlatan 'open to Napoli switch' Zlatan could move to Napoli, says Raiola (Photo: Clive Mason) 
Manchester United forward Zlatan Ibrahimovic could be open to a sensational move to Napoli, claims Mino Raiola. 
The super agent, who was born close to Naples, insists the Swede loves the city and that a move is not out of the question, writes Mirror Football's Jack Rathborn. 
With 19 goals already this season, Jose Mourinho will be desperate to keep the 35-year-old, but despite an option to extend his deal by a year, Raiola has sparked talk of a move back to Italy. 
"As for Ibrahimovic, he's always been in love with Naples and the passion of the Neopolitans and I've always said that openly because he grew up in a family which was to the Neapolitans and then with me," Raiola told Radio CRC. Read More
